notes: Eighth-generation Civic. Available as sedan or coupe. Si performance variant. Manual transmission available. Sporty design. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Civic article, January 2025 revision.

Seventh-generation Civic. Available as sedan, coupe, or hatchback. Si with K20 engine. Manual transmission available. Reliable compact. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Civic article, January 2025 revision.
Eighth-generation Accord. Available as sedan or coupe. Manual transmission available. V6 option. Popular mid-size sedan. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Accord article, January 2025 revision.
Seventh-generation Accord. Available as sedan or coupe. Manual transmission available. V6 performance. Mid-size leader. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Accord article, January 2025 revision.
Third-generation CR-V. I4-only powertrain. Manual transmission available. AWD optional. Compact crossover leader. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda CR-V article, January 2025 revision.
Second-generation CR-V. I4-only powertrain. Manual transmission available. AWD optional. Popular compact SUV. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda CR-V article, January 2025 revision.
First-generation Pilot. Three-row seating for 8. V6-only powertrain. Based on Odyssey platform. Family SUV. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Pilot article, January 2025 revision.
Second-generation Pilot. Three-row seating for 8. V6-only powertrain. Refined and spacious. Popular family SUV. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Pilot article, January 2025 revision.
First-generation Ridgeline. Unibody construction. AWD standard. In-bed trunk. Dual-action tailgate. Unique truck design. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Ridgeline article, January 2025 revision.
Third-generation Odyssey. Seven or eight-passenger seating. V6-only powertrain. Flat-folding seats. Premium minivan. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Odyssey article, January 2025 revision.

Unique boxy utility vehicle. Rear-hinged rear doors. Waterproof interior. Manual transmission available. AWD optional. Cult following. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Element article, January 2025 revision.

First-generation Insight. First hybrid sold in America. Aluminum body. Manual transmission available. 61-70 mpg. Aerodynamic design. Hybrid system requires specialized service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Insight article, January 2025 revision.

Legendary roadster. 9,000 rpm redline (AP1). Manual transmission only. Rear-wheel drive. VTEC performance. Cult classic sports car. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda S2000 article, January 2025 revision.
